newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA BUSINESS GIANT PLANS BALKAN EXPANSION.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA BUSINESS GIANT PLANS BALKAN EXPANSION.

text.p: Multigroup, Bulgaria's most powerful business holding, linked to Russian gas giant RAO Gazprom , plans to expand its activities in the Balkans this year, its president said.
Ilia Pavlov told Reuters that the corporation, currently consolidating its subsidiaries, has given priority to developing its energy businesses.
"We are planning to be more active on the Balkan market this year not only through sales of Russian electricity but also by building and operating mining projects," Pavlov said.

The corporation is part of the Bulgarian-Russian gas joint stock company Topenergy, which plans to participate in two tenders for pipeline concessions to transport Russian gas through Bulgarian territory.
Multigroup and its gas arm Overgas each have 8.25 percent stakes in Topenergy while Gazprom has 50 percent.
Bulgaria announced the two pipeline concessions on Tuesday and is expected to call the tenders within a month.

Multigroup, which sprang up amid the legal and administrative chaos that followed the collapse of communism, expects to top its usual $50 million annual investment in the region if Topenergy starts work this year on enlarging Bulgaria's pipeline network.
Pavlov said Greece had shown interest in Multigroup's mining projects and the holding also planned to develop such projects in Turkey.
He said Multigroup was withholding its activities in Serbia for political reasons.
In October, Multigroup signed a memorandum with Gazprom and RAO United Energy Systems for joint production, sale and transiting of electricity.
"We united the efforts of the three companies for a joint investment policy in the Balkan region," Pavlov said. He said Bulgaria could become a regional energy distribution centre.
